comments:
testRuleInValidStructuredOutput is failing because its associated output file is  not being generated.

David, please investigate the problem.
Thanks.

When I use the Sun 1.5.0_11 JVM + Xalan.jar, this failure no longer occurs. 
Likewise, when I use the IBM 1.5 VM, this failure no longer occurs.  Therefore,
it appears we need to bundle the Xalan.jar if we are going to support the Sun
VM.
Xalan.jar is approved for use with COSMOS per IPZilla CQ: https://dev.eclipse.org/ipzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=1320

I found that serializer.jar is also needed for the tests to pass.  The interesting thing is that serializer.jar doesn't have to be in your classpath.  The class loader is able to find it as long as it's under the 'lib' directory.  This might explain why David didn't notice the need for serializer.jar.

This is the exception that I get in the absence of serializer.jar:

Thanks, Ali.

serializer.jar is approved for use with COSMOS per IPZilla CQ: https://dev.eclipse.org/ipzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=1413
Requesting PMC approval to make fix for inclusion in i6.  Rebuild request will be forthcoming pending analysis on failures found in another JUnit test.
